FuncDef:
The esi command configures an Ethernet segment identifier (ESI) in the VSI-LDP-PW view.
The undo esi command deletes an ESI in the VSI-LDP-PW view.
By default, no ESI is configured in the VSI-LDP-PW view.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an ESI.
The value is in the format of xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx, where x is a hexadecimal number ranging from 0 to F. The value of esi must start with 00 and cannot be all 0s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a VPLS splicing with EVPN MPLS scenario, to allow Ethernet Segment routes and Ethernet A-D routes to be transmitted over an EVPN, run the esi command in the VSI-LDP-PW view to configure an ESI for the access side of the EVPN.
